title: 1,900-Mile 2014 Ducati 1199 Superleggera
description: This 2014 Ducati 1199 Superleggera is #234 of 500 examples produced and has 1,900 miles through the seller's purchase in 2024. It is finished in Corse Red and white and is powered by a 1,198cc Superquadro L-twin paired with a six-speed transmission. Equipment includes an Akrapovic titanium exhaust system, a magnesium monocoque frame, 17" Marchesini tri-spoke forged magnesium wheels, black rider seating, clip-on handlebars, an Öhlins steering damper, LED lighting, a carbon-fiber subframe and front fender, Ducati’s Quick Shift (DQS) system, and triple Brembo disc brakes with cornering ABS. The electronics package includes a color TFT digital dashboard with controls for the suspension, engine braking control, riding and power modes, and EVO traction and wheelie control. This 1199 Superleggera is now offered with the owner's manual, manufacturer's literature, a rear stand, a bike cover, and a clean Michigan title in the seller's name.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 1,900-Mile 2014 Ducati 1199 Superleggera at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #191,261.
text: This 2014 Ducati 1199 Superleggera is #234 of 500 examples produced and has 1,900 miles through the seller’s purchase in 2024. It is finished in Corse Red and white and is powered by a 1,198cc Superquadro L-twin paired with a six-speed transmission. Equipment includes an Akrapovic titanium exhaust system, a magnesium monocoque frame, 17″ Marchesini tri-spoke forged magnesium wheels, black rider seating, clip-on handlebars, an Öhlins steering damper, LED lighting, a carbon-fiber subframe and front fender, Ducati’s Quick Shift (DQS) system, and triple Brembo disc brakes with cornering ABS. The electronics package includes a color TFT digital dashboard with controls for the suspension, engine braking control, riding and power modes, and EVO traction and wheelie control. This 1199 Superleggera is now offered with the owner’s manual, manufacturer’s literature, a rear stand, a bike cover, and a clean Michigan title in the seller’s name. This Superleggera example includes bodywork finished in Corse Red and white with carbon-fiber accents and is mounted over a magnesium monocoque frame. Additional features include black rider seating, a vented tail section, a carbon-fiber subframe and front fender, LED lighting, a rear fender eliminator kit, titanium fasteners, a fuel tank protector pad, and a side stand. Paint protection film has been applied to the bodywork, per the seller. The bronze-finished 17″ Marchesini tri-spoke forged magnesium wheels are mounted with Pirelli Diablo Supercorsa SP tires. The bike is equipped with Bosch 9ME six-axis ABS, and stopping power is provided by dual 330mm discs with radially mounted Brembo M50 four-piston calipers up front as well as a 245mm disc with a Brembo two-piston caliper at the rear. Adjustable Öhlins suspension consists of a 43mm FL916 inverted fork with titanium nitride-coated stanchions as well as a TTX36 titanium-spring piggyback monoshock that is connected to the aluminum single-sided swingarm via adjustable linkage. Clip-on handlebars secured beneath the upper triple clamp frame a color TFT screen that displays a digital speedometer, an arcing bar-style tachometer, a coolant-temperature gauge, and a gear indicator along with indicator lamps for ABS, neutral gear selection, oil pressure, and side stand position. Also provided are readouts for a suite of onboard electronics that include riding modes, adjustable ABS, Ducati Traction Control (DTC), Ducati Wheelie Control (DWC), and Engine Brake Control (EBC) as well as a GPS-enabled Ducati Data Analysis+ (DDA+) system that records and displays vehicle lean angles. The digital odometer indicates 1,900 miles, approximately 100 of which have been ridden under current ownership. An adjustable Öhlins piston-style steering damper spans the right handlebar clamp and the frame, and laser inscription on the upper triple clamp denotes the bike as #234 of 500 examples produced for the model year. The 1,198cc Superquadro L-twin features chain-driven double-overhead camshafts and four desmodromically actuated titanium valves per cylinder as well as a ride-by-wire throttle, Mitsubishi fuel injection, titanium connecting rods, a lightweight crankshaft with tungsten balance inserts, two-ring pistons, and an Akrapovic titanium exhaust system. An oil change was performed in November 2024. Power is routed to the rear wheel through an oiled slipper clutch, a six-speed transmission equipped with the Ducati Quick Shift (DQS) system, and a drive chain. The owner’s manual, manufacturer’s literature, a rear stand, and a bike cover are included in the sale. You are not connected to real-time updates. Attempting to connect. html:
This 2014 Ducati 1199 Superleggera is #234 of 500 examples produced and has 1,900 miles through the seller’s purchase in 2024. It is finished in Corse Red and white and is powered by a 1,198cc Superquadro L-twin paired with a six-speed transmission. Equipment includes an Akrapovic titanium exhaust system, a magnesium monocoque frame, 17″ Marchesini tri-spoke forged magnesium wheels, black rider seating, clip-on handlebars, an Öhlins steering damper, LED lighting, a carbon-fiber subframe and front fender, Ducati’s Quick Shift (DQS) system, and triple Brembo disc brakes with cornering ABS. The electronics package includes a color TFT digital dashboard with controls for the suspension, engine braking control, riding and power modes, and EVO traction and wheelie control. This 1199 Superleggera is now offered with the owner’s manual, manufacturer’s literature, a rear stand, a bike cover, and a clean Michigan title in the seller’s name.

This Superleggera example includes bodywork finished in Corse Red and white with carbon-fiber accents and is mounted over a magnesium monocoque frame. Additional features include black rider seating, a vented tail section, a carbon-fiber subframe and front fender, LED lighting, a rear fender eliminator kit, titanium fasteners, a fuel tank protector pad, and a side stand. Paint protection film has been applied to the bodywork, per the seller.

The bronze-finished 17″ Marchesini tri-spoke forged magnesium wheels are mounted with Pirelli Diablo Supercorsa SP tires. The bike is equipped with Bosch 9ME six-axis ABS, and stopping power is provided by dual 330mm discs with radially mounted Brembo M50 four-piston calipers up front as well as a 245mm disc with a Brembo two-piston caliper at the rear.

Adjustable Öhlins suspension consists of a 43mm FL916 inverted fork with titanium nitride-coated stanchions as well as a TTX36 titanium-spring piggyback monoshock that is connected to the aluminum single-sided swingarm via adjustable linkage.

Clip-on handlebars secured beneath the upper triple clamp frame a color TFT screen that displays a digital speedometer, an arcing bar-style tachometer, a coolant-temperature gauge, and a gear indicator along with indicator lamps for ABS, neutral gear selection, oil pressure, and side stand position. Also provided are readouts for a suite of onboard electronics that include riding modes, adjustable ABS, Ducati Traction Control (DTC), Ducati Wheelie Control (DWC), and Engine Brake Control (EBC) as well as a GPS-enabled Ducati Data Analysis+ (DDA+) system that records and displays vehicle lean angles. The digital odometer indicates 1,900 miles, approximately 100 of which have been ridden under current ownership.

An adjustable Öhlins piston-style steering damper spans the right handlebar clamp and the frame, and laser inscription on the upper triple clamp denotes the bike as #234 of 500 examples produced for the model year.

The 1,198cc Superquadro L-twin features chain-driven double-overhead camshafts and four desmodromically actuated titanium valves per cylinder as well as a ride-by-wire throttle, Mitsubishi fuel injection, titanium connecting rods, a lightweight crankshaft with tungsten balance inserts, two-ring pistons, and an Akrapovic titanium exhaust system. An oil change was performed in November 2024.

Power is routed to the rear wheel through an oiled slipper clutch, a six-speed transmission equipped with the Ducati Quick Shift (DQS) system, and a drive chain.

The owner’s manual, manufacturer’s literature, a rear stand, and a bike cover are included in the sale.
